titleInfo.title: Bill of sale for Sephus, an enslaved boy, in Williamson County, Tennessee, from Timothy [Terrell?], to William Harrison, Jr., 1844 January 18

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: A bill of sale from Williamson County, Tennessee, documenting the purchase of a " Negro boy named Sephus aged about six years" by William Harrison, Jr., from Timothy [Terrell?] in Williamson County, Tennessee on Jan. 18, 1844 for the sum of two hundred and twenty-five dollars. Terrell warrants that Sephus is "sound, healthy, sensible, and a slave for life." A later date of Sept. 5, 1844 is given as the date that Lemuel B. McConnico, clerk of the Williamson County Court witnessed the document. It also states it was registered in "note book no. 1, page 52" on Sept. 6, 1844 by J.R. Hunter. Forms part of the Harrison House Collection. 1 document : b & w ; 20 x 24 cm.
